page.title: 03Abinger Hammer & Gomshall 3
page.content:
Abinger Hammer and Gomshall are both small villages but are popular with visitors to the area. Abinger Hammer is well known for its village clock and bell. The bell is struck on the hour by a model blacksmith. This is a reminder of the forge and ironworks that used to flourish in the area.
Gomshall is known for its tannery and the old mill. The presence of the leather industry in the area is said to date back to Norman times. The Old Mill is now a restaurant.
Antique shops are to be found in both villages together with an art gallery in Gomshall.
